name: Andreas Kaminski
title: Dr. phil.
cv: Andreas Kaminski represents the chair of Prof. Dr. Gabriele Gramelsberger (Theory of Science and Technology) in the summer semester 2020. He is head of the Department of Philosophy of Science and Technology at the Federal Supercomputing Centre at the University of Stuttgart (HLRS). Andreas Kaminski received his doctorate at the TU Darmstadt (2009). He is co-founder of the Jahrbuch Technikphilosophie (2015 ff.), was speaker of the DFG network "Geschichte der Prüfungstechniken 1900-2000" (2015-2018) and is a member of the Artificial Intelligence Ethical Impact Group, which has developed a novel standardization proposal for AI (2020). Kaminski concentrates on three lines of research: 1. Philosophy of science and technology: What role does (information) technology play in the acquisition of knowledge? 2. Epistemology of witnessing and philosophy of trust: What role do trust and sociality play in the acquisition of knowledge? 3. History of psychometry: What role do psychological measuring methods (especially tests) play for self-relationships?
researchInterests: Philosophy of Science and Technology; Epistemology; History of Psychometry; Phenomenology
